meanings.definition: The direction towards which the sun sets, opposite of east.
meanings.sent1: The sun dips below the horizon in the west every evening.
meanings.sent2: She traveled from the east to the west of the country.
meanings.sent3: The west side of the house always gets the most beautiful sunsets.
meanings.sent4: His dreams flew westward, chasing the setting sun.
meanings.sent5: The west is like a canvas painted with the colors of dusk.

meanings.definition: The western part of a country or region.
meanings.sent1: The west of the country is known for its stunning landscapes.
meanings.sent2: They explored the wild west during their road trip.
meanings.sent3: The west is where the cowboys used to roam freely.
meanings.sent4: In the west, the mountains rise majestically against the sky.
meanings.sent5: The west holds the promise of adventure and new beginnings.

meanings.definition: To move or turn in a westward direction.
meanings.sent1: They decided to westward towards the setting sun.
meanings.sent2: The ship will west across the ocean towards the new land.
meanings.sent3: The birds westward in search of warmer climates.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts always west towards home when he was far away.
meanings.sent5: The river gently westward, carrying dreams and memories with it.
